Description: An issue was discovered in the server in OpenLDAP before 2.4.48. When the server administrator delegates rootDN (database admin) privileges for certain databases but wants to maintain isolation (e.g., for multi-tenant deployments), slapd does not properly stop a rootDN from requesting authorization as an identity from another database during a SASL bind or with a proxyAuthz (RFC 4370) control. (It is not a common configuration to deploy a system where the server administrator and a DB administrator enjoy different levels of trust.)

Title: CVE-2019-9923  NULL Pointer Dereference

Description: GNU Tar through 1.30, when --sparse is used, mishandles file shrinkage during read access, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (infinite read loop in sparse_dump_region in sparse.c) by modifying a file that is supposed to be archived by a different user's process (e.g., a system backup running as root).
Title: CVE-2018-20482  Out-of-bounds Read

Description: It was found that polkit could be tricked into bypassing the credential checks for D-Bus requests, elevating the privileges of the requestor to the root user. This flaw could be used by an unprivileged local attacker to, for example, create a new local administrator. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
Title: CVE-2021-3560

Description: Security Review (CST-E) This package version is vulnerable to elevation-of-privileges. All users must upgrade to the latest version (3.42.1 or later). For more information see [aka.ms/vuln-093611](https://aka.ms/vuln-093611).
Title: CST-E has determined that this component is not generally safe to use.

Title: CST-E has determined that this component is not generally safe to use.

Description: Double free vulnerability in libxml2 2.7.8 and other versions, as used in Google Chrome before 8.0.552.215 and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectors related to XPath handling.
Title: CVE-2010-4494

Description: Double free vulnerability in libxml2, as used in Google Chrome before 13.0.782.215, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted XPath expression.
Title: CVE-2011-2821

Description: CVE-2022-40304 libxml2: dict corruption caused by entity reference cycles
Title: CVE-2022-40304

Description: CVE-2022-40303 libxml2: integer overflows with XML_PARSE_HUGE
Title: CVE-2022-40303

Description: Security Review (CST-E) This package contains a critical security vulnerability that can lead to remote code execution when an untrusted payload is deserialized. If you are processing untrusted payloads, you must upgrade to the latest version of this library (at least v5.0.13) prior to February 1, 2023. You must also plan for migration to an alternate library by July 1, 2023.  Where possible, ensure that MDE is deployed to your service to detect abuse.
Title: CST-E has determined that this component is not generally safe to use.

Description: ### Impact Access to lateral directories when using `app.static` if using encoded `%2F` URLs. Parent directory traversal is not impacted.  ### Patches - v20.12.7 (LTS) - v21.12.2 (LTS) - v22.6.1  ### References https://github.com/sanic-org/sanic/issues/2478 https://github.com/sanic-org/sanic/pull/2495  ### For more information If you have any questions or comments about this advisory: * Open an issue in [the community forums](https://community.sanicframework.org/) * Ping us on [the Discord server](https://discord.gg/FARQzAEMAA)
Title: CVE-2022-35920

Description: Sanic v20.12 officially supports Python versions 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, and 3.9. However, if you accidentally run it with version 3.10 (which is not supported by Sanic 20.12), your server is prone to crashing on an incoming web request.
Title: WS-2022-0084

Description: A specific description has not been provided for this vulnerability, see the advisory link below for more information.
Title: CVE-2022-41953

Description: A specific description has not been provided for this vulnerability, see the advisory link below for more information.
Title: CVE-2022-23521

Description: A specific description has not been provided for this vulnerability, see the advisory link below for more information.
Title: CVE-2022-41903

Description: ### Impact  Automatically generated `NumberFilter` instances, whose value was later converted to an integer, were subject to potential DoS from maliciously input using exponential format with sufficiently large exponents.   ### Patches  Version 2.4.0+ applies a `MaxValueValidator` with a a default `limit_value` of 1e50 to the form field used by `NumberFilter` instances.   In addition, `NumberFilter` implements the new `get_max_validator()` which should return a configured validator instance to customise the limit, or else `None` to disable the additional validation.   ### Workarounds  Users may manually apply an equivalent validator if they are not able to upgrade.    ### For more information If you have any questions or comments about this advisory: * Open an issue in [the django-filter repo](https://github.com/carltongibson/django-filter)  Thanks to Marcin Waraksa for the report.
Title: CVE-2020-15225

Description: A flaw was found in Django REST Framework versions before 3.12.0 and before 3.11.2. When using the browseable API viewer, Django REST Framework fails to properly escape certain strings that can come from user input. This allows a user who can control those strings to inject malicious <script> tags, leading to a cross-site-scripting (XSS) vulnerability.
Title: CVE-2020-25626

Description: Django-Rest-Framework, before 3.9.1, has a XSS vulnerability caused by disabled autoescaping in the default DRF Browsable API view templates.
Title: WS-2019-0037

Description: A flaw was found in python-oslo-utils. Due to improper parsing, passwords with a double quote ( " ) in them cause incorrect masking in debug logs, causing any part of the password after the double quote to be plaintext.
Title: CVE-2022-0718

Description: Security Review (CST-E) This package version is vulnerable to elevation-of-privileges. All users must upgrade to the latest version (3.42.1 or later). For more information see [aka.ms/vuln-093611](https://aka.ms/vuln-093611).
Title: CST-E has determined that this component is not generally safe to use.

Description: A vulnerability in the .NET SDK of Apache Avro allows an attacker to allocate excessive resources, potentially causing a denial-of-service attack. This issue affects .NET applications using Apache Avro version 1.10.2 and prior versions. Users should update to version 1.11.0 which addresses this issue.
Title: CVE-2021-43045

Description: The sudoedit personality of Sudo before 1.9.5 may allow a local unprivileged user to perform arbitrary directory-existence tests by winning a sudo_edit.c race condition in replacing a user-controlled directory by a symlink to an arbitrary path.
Title: CVE-2021-23239

Description: In iana-time-zone v0.1.43 and before v0.1.45, a use-after-free bug in the MacOS / iOS implementation was introduced.  The copied system time zone was released before its name was copied. If the system time zone was changed between the call of CFRelease and str::to_owned(), random memory would be copied.
Title: WS-2022-0274

Description: n iana-time-zone v0.1.43 a use-after-free bug in the MacOS / iOS implementation was introduced.  The copied system time zone was released before its name was copied. If the system time zone was changed between the call of CFRelease and str::to_owned(), random memory would be copied.
Title: WS-2022-0282

Description: An Ubuntu-specific modification to AccountsService in versions before 0.6.55-0ubuntu13.2, among other earlier versions, improperly dropped the ruid, allowing untrusted users to send signals to AccountService, thus stopping it from handling D-Bus messages in a timely fashion.
Title: CVE-2020-16126

Description: Ubuntu-specific modifications to accountsservice (in patch file debian/patches/0010-set-language.patch) caused the fallback_locale variable, pointing to static storage, to be freed, in the user_change_language_authorized_cb function. This is reachable via the SetLanguage dbus function. This is fixed in versions 0.6.55-0ubuntu12~20.04.5, 0.6.55-0ubuntu13.3, 0.6.55-0ubuntu14.1.
Title: CVE-2021-3939

Description: An Ubuntu-specific modification to AccountsService in versions before 0.6.55-0ubuntu13.2, among other earlier versions, would perform unbounded read operations on user-controlled ~/.pam_environment files, allowing an infinite loop if /dev/zero is symlinked to this location.
Title: CVE-2020-16127

Description: It was discovered that read_file() in apport/hookutils.py would follow symbolic links or open FIFOs. When this function is used by the openjdk-15 package apport hooks, it could expose private data to other local users.
Title: CVE-2021-32551

Description: An information disclosure via path traversal was discovered in apport/hookutils.py function read_file(). This issue affects: apport 2.14.1 versions prior to 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm8; 2.20.1 versions prior to 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm2; 2.20.9 versions prior to 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.26; 2.20.11 versions prior to 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.20; 2.20.11 versions prior to 2.20.11-0ubuntu65.3;
Title: CVE-2021-3710

Description: It was discovered that apport in data/apport did not properly open a report file to prevent hanging reads on a FIFO.
Title: CVE-2021-25684

Description: is_closing_session() allows users to consume RAM in the Apport process
Title: CVE-2022-28656

Description: There is a race condition in the 'replaced executable' detection that, with the correct local configuration, allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code as root.

Description: TOCTOU Race Condition vulnerability in apport allows a local attacker to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code. An attacker may exit the crashed process and exploit PID recycling to spawn a root process with the same PID as the crashed process, which can then be used to escalate privileges. Fixed in 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.24, 2.20.9 versions prior to 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.16 and 2.20.11 versions prior to 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.6. Was ZDI-CAN-11234.

Title: CVE-2017-7613

Description: The ebl_object_note_type_name function in eblobjnotetypename.c in elfutils 0.168 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted ELF file.

Description: In Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3, a left shift by 29 (or more) places in the storeAtts function in xmlparse.c can lead to realloc misbehavior (e.g., allocating too few bytes, or only freeing memory).

Description: addBinding in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has an integer overflow.

Description: In libexpat through 2.4.9, there is a use-after free caused by overeager destruction of a shared DTD in XML_ExternalEntityParserCreate in out-of-memory situations.

Description: In doProlog in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3, an integer overflow exists for m_groupSize.

Description: xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5 allows attackers to insert namespace-separator characters into namespace URIs.

Title: CVE-2022-22823

Title: CVE-2022-23852

Description: In Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5, an attacker can trigger stack exhaustion in build_model via a large nesting depth in the DTD element.
Title: CVE-2022-25313

Description: lookup in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has an integer overflow.
Title: CVE-2022-22825

Description: Expat allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed input document, which triggers a buffer overflow.
Title: CVE-2016-0718

Description: xmltok_impl.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5 lacks certain validation of encoding, such as checks for whether a UTF-8 character is valid in a certain context.
Title: CVE-2022-25235

Description: nextScaffoldPart in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has an integer overflow.
Title: CVE-2022-22826

Description: In Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5, there is an integer overflow in storeRawNames.
Title: CVE-2022-25315

Description: In libexpat in Expat before 2.2.7, XML input including XML names that contain a large number of colons could make the XML parser consume a high amount of RAM and CPU resources while processing (enough to be usable for denial-of-service attacks).
Title: CVE-2018-20843

Description: storeAtts in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has an integer overflow.
Title: CVE-2022-22827

Description: The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service.
Title: CVE-2016-10228

Description: The iconv feature in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.32, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in the EUC-KR encoding, may have a buffer over-read.
Title: CVE-2019-25013

Description: A flaw was found in glibc. An off-by-one buffer overflow and underflow in getcwd() may lead to memory corruption when the size of the buffer is exactly 1. A local attacker who can control the input buffer and size passed to getcwd() in a setuid program could use this flaw to potentially execute arbitrary code and escalate their privileges on the system.
Title: CVE-2021-3999

Description: The deprecated compatibility function clnt_create in the sunrpc module of the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.34 copies its hostname argument on the stack without validating its length, which may result in a buffer overflow, potentially resulting in a denial of service or (if an application is not built with a stack protector enabled) arbitrary code execution.
Title: CVE-2022-23219

Description: The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3 encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service.
Title: CVE-2021-3326

Description: The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.30 to 2.32, when converting UCS4 text containing an irreversible character, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service.
Title: CVE-2020-29562

Description: The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228.
Title: CVE-2020-27618

Description: An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data.
Title: CVE-2020-6096

Description: The deprecated compatibility function svcunix_create in the sunrpc module of the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.34 copies its path argument on the stack without validating its length, which may result in a buffer overflow, potentially resulting in a denial of service or (if an application is not built with a stack protector enabled) arbitrary code execution.
Title: CVE-2022-23218

Description: The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c.
Title: CVE-2021-27645

Description: The wordexp function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.33 may crash or read arbitrary memory in parse_param (in posix/wordexp.c) when called with an untrusted, crafted pattern, potentially resulting in a denial of service or disclosure of information. This occurs because atoi was used but strtoul should have been used to ensure correct calculations.
Title: CVE-2021-35942

Description: In OpenSSH 7.9, scp.c in the scp client allows remote SSH servers to bypass intended access restrictions via the filename of . or an empty filename. The impact is modifying the permissions of the target directory on the client side.
Title: CVE-2018-20685

Description: An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to missing character encoding in the progress display, a malicious server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can employ crafted object names to manipulate the client output, e.g., by using ANSI control codes to hide additional files being transferred. This affects refresh_progress_meter() in progressmeter.c.
Title: CVE-2019-6109

Description: ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 8.5 has a double free that may be relevant in a few less-common scenarios, such as unconstrained agent-socket access on a legacy operating system, or the forwarding of an agent to an attacker-controlled host.
Title: CVE-2021-28041

Description: The process_open function in sftp-server.c in OpenSSH before 7.6 does not properly prevent write operations in readonly mode, which allows attackers to create zero-length files.
Title: CVE-2017-15906

Description: An issue was discovered in p11-kit 0.21.1 through 0.23.21. A heap-based buffer over-read has been discovered in the RPC protocol used by thep11-kit server/remote commands and the client library. When the remote entity supplies a byte array through a serialized PKCS#11 function call, the receiving entity may allow the reading of up to 4 bytes of memory past the heap allocation.
Title: CVE-2020-29362

Description: An issue was discovered in p11-kit 0.23.6 through 0.23.21. A heap-based buffer overflow has been discovered in the RPC protocol used by p11-kit server/remote commands and the client library. When the remote entity supplies a serialized byte array in a CK_ATTRIBUTE, the receiving entity may not allocate sufficient length for the buffer to store the deserialized value.
Title: CVE-2020-29363

Description: An issue was discovered in p11-kit 0.21.1 through 0.23.21. Multiple integer overflows have been discovered in the array allocations in the p11-kit library and the p11-kit list command, where overflow checks are missing before calling realloc or calloc.
Title: CVE-2020-29361

Description: encoding.c in GNU Screen through 4.8.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid write access and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted UTF-8 character sequence.
Title: CVE-2021-26937

Description: The ppp decapsulator in tcpdump 4.9.3 can be convinced to allocate a large amount of memory.
Title: CVE-2020-8037

Description: The command-line argument parser in tcpdump before 4.99.0 has a buffer overflow in tcpdump.c:read_infile(). To trigger this vulnerability the attacker needs to create a 4GB file on the local filesystem and to specify the file name as the value of the -F command-line argument of tcpdump.

Description: A heap use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd before version v245-rc1, where asynchronous Polkit queries are performed while handling dbus messages. Title: CVE-2020-1712

Description: popd in bash might allow local users to bypass the restricted shell and cause a use-after-free via a crafted address.
Title: CVE-2016-9401

Description: In situations where an attacker receives automated notification of the success or failure of a decryption attempt an attacker, after sending a very large number of messages to be decrypted, can recover a CMS/PKCS7 transported encryption key or decrypt any RSA encrypted message that was encrypted with the public RSA key, using a Bleichenbacher padding oracle attack. Applications are not affected if they use a certificate together with the private RSA key to the CMS_decrypt or PKCS7_decrypt functions to select the correct recipient info to decrypt. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1d (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1c). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0l (Affected 1.1.0-1.1.0k). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2t (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2s).
Title: CVE-2019-1563

Description: The OpenSSL ECDSA signature algorithm has been shown to be vulnerable to a timing side channel attack. An attacker could use variations in the signing algorithm to recover the private key. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0j (Affected 1.1.0-1.1.0i). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1a (Affected 1.1.1).
Title: CVE-2018-0735

Description: Normally in OpenSSL EC groups always have a co-factor present and this is used in side channel resistant code paths. However, in some cases, it is possible to construct a group using explicit parameters (instead of using a named curve). In those cases it is possible that such a group does not have the cofactor present. This can occur even where all the parameters match a known named curve. If such a curve is used then OpenSSL falls back to non-side channel resistant code paths which may result in full key recovery during an ECDSA signature operation. In order to be vulnerable an attacker would have to have the ability to time the creation of a large number of signatures where explicit parameters with no co-factor present are in use by an application using libcrypto. For the avoidance of doubt libssl is not vulnerable because explicit parameters are never used. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1d (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1c). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0l (Affected 1.1.0-1.1.0k). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2t (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2s).
Title: CVE-2019-1547

Description: The OpenSSL DSA signature algorithm has been shown to be vulnerable to a timing side channel attack. An attacker could use variations in the signing algorithm to recover the private key. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1a (Affected 1.1.1). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0j (Affected 1.1.0-1.1.0i). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2q (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2p).
Title: CVE-2018-0734

Description: There is an overflow bug in the x64_64 Montgomery squaring procedure used in exponentiation with 512-bit moduli. No EC algorithms are affected. Analysis suggests that attacks against 2-prime RSA1024, 3-prime RSA1536, and DSA1024 as a result of this defect would be very difficult to perform and are not believed likely. Attacks against DH512 are considered just feasible. However, for an attack the target would have to re-use the DH512 private key, which is not recommended anyway. Also applications directly using the low level API BN_mod_exp may be affected if they use BN_FLG_CONSTTIME. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1e (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1d). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2u (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2t).
Title: CVE-2019-1551

Description: Server or client applications that call the SSL_check_chain() function during or after a TLS 1.3 handshake may crash due to a NULL pointer dereference as a result of incorrect handling of the "signature_algorithms_cert" TLS extension. The crash occurs if an invalid or unrecognised signature algorithm is received from the peer. This could be exploited by a malicious peer in a Denial of Service attack. OpenSSL version 1.1.1d, 1.1.1e, and 1.1.1f are affected by this issue. This issue did not affect OpenSSL versions prior to 1.1.1d. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1g (Affected 1.1.1d-1.1.1f).
Title: CVE-2020-1967

Description: OpenSSL 1.1.1 introduced a rewritten random number generator (RNG). This was intended to include protection in the event of a fork() system call in order to ensure that the parent and child processes did not share the same RNG state. However this protection was not being used in the default case. A partial mitigation for this issue is that the output from a high precision timer is mixed into the RNG state so the likelihood of a parent and child process sharing state is significantly reduced. If an application already calls OPENSSL_init_crypto() explicitly using OPENSSL_INIT_ATFORK then this problem does not occur at all. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1d (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1c).
Title: CVE-2019-1549

Description: Node text does not escape html in Jstree, This is a potential XSS issue.
Title: WS-2014-0029

Description: Security Review (CST-E) There is a known buffer overflow vulnerability present in this version that is fixed in version 1.8.1, as shown here: https://github.com/open-source- parsers/jsoncpp/commit/7f9cc2705c0eb2d424891ab0c470d7c69486fdbb.
Title: CST-E has determined that this component is not generally safe to use.

Description: {fmt} / fmtlib contains a flaw in the BasicWriter<Char>::prepare_int_buffer() template function in fmt/format.h that is triggered when handling complex pointer formatting. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to corrupt memory and crash a process linked against the library.
Title: CVE-2018-1000052

Description: SQLite contains an out-of-bounds read flaw in the rtreenode() function in ext/rtree/rtree.c that is triggered when handling invalid rtree tables. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library or potentially disclose memory contents.
Title: CVE-2019-8457

Description: SQLite contains a divide-by-zero flaw in the whereLoopAddBtreeIndex() function in sqlite3.c that is triggered as input passed to the sqlite_stat1 sz field is not properly validated. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to cause a denial of service in a process linked against the library.
Title: CVE-2019-16168

Description: VTK contains a flaw in the vtkMoleculeAppend() function in Filters/Core/vtkMoleculeAppend.h that is triggered when handling a string array. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: VTK Filters/Core/vtkMoleculeAppend.h vtkMoleculeAppend() Function String Array Handling DoS

Description: VTK contains a flaw in the vtkImageBlendCompoundTransferExecute() function in Imaging/Core/vtkImageBlend.cxx. The issue is triggered as certain input is not properly validated. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to corrupt memory and cause a denial of service for a process linked against the library or potentially execute arbitrary code.
Title: VTK Imaging/Core/vtkImageBlend.cxx vtkImageBlendCompoundTransferExecute() Function Unspecified Memory Corruption

Description: VTK contains a flaw in the vtkShadowMapBakerPass::Render() function in Rendering/OpenGL2/vtkShadowMapBakerPass.cxx that is triggered during the handling of props. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: VTK Rendering/OpenGL2/vtkShadowMapBakerPass.cxx vtkShadowMapBakerPass::Render() Function Prop Handling DoS

Description: VTK contains a flaw in the vtkRTAnalyticSource::RequestInformation() function in Imaging/Core/vtkRTAnalyticSource.cxx that is triggered when handling SubsampleRate. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: VTK Imaging/Core/vtkRTAnalyticSource.cxx vtkRTAnalyticSource::RequestInformation() Function SubsampleRate Handling DoS

Description: VTK contains a flaw in the vtkBandedPolyDataContourFilter::RequestData() function in Filters/Modeling/vtkBandedPolyDataContourFilter.cxx that is triggered during the handling of contour bands. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: VTK Filters/Modeling/vtkBandedPolyDataContourFilter.cxx vtkBandedPolyDataContourFilter::RequestData() Function Contour Band Hand

Description: VTK contains a NULL pointer dereference flaw in the eglQueryString() function in Rendering/OpenGL2/vtkEGLRenderWindow.cxx that is triggered when handling an empty string. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: VTK Rendering/OpenGL2/vtkEGLRenderWindow.cxx eglQueryString() Function String Handling NULL Pointer Dereference DoS

Description: VTK contains an overflow condition in the vtkInteractorEventRecorder::Play() function in Rendering/Core/vtkInteractorEventRecorder.cxx. The issue is triggered as certain input is not properly validated. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to cause a buffer overflow, resulting in a denial of service for a process linked against the library or potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code.
Title: VTK Rendering/Core/vtkInteractorEventRecorder.cxx vtkInteractorEventRecorder::Play() Function Buffer Overflow

Description: VTK contains a flaw in multiple functions within Common/DataModel/vtkCellLocator.cxx that is triggered when input data with no cells is set. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: VTK Common/DataModel/vtkCellLocator.cxx Multiple Function Input Data Handling DoS

Description: VTK contains an overflow condition in the vtkGLTFDocumentLoaderInternals::LoadFileMetaData() function in IO/Geometry/vtkGLTFDocumentLoaderInternals.cxx. The issue is triggered as certain input is not properly validated when handling JSON chunk data. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to cause a buffer overflow, resulting in a denial of service for a process linked against the library or potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code.
Title: VTK IO/Geometry/vtkGLTFDocumentLoaderInternals.cxx vtkGLTFDocumentLoaderInternals::LoadFileMetaData() Function JSON Chunk Data H

Description: VTK contains an out-of-bounds access flaw in the vtkHyperTreeGridSource::InitializeFromStringDescriptor() function in Filters/Sources/vtkHyperTreeGridSource.cxx that is triggered when handling descriptors in the HTG source. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to have an unspecified impact.
Title: VTK Filters/Sources/vtkHyperTreeGridSource.cxx vtkHyperTreeGridSource::InitializeFromStringDescriptor() Function Out-of-bounds A

Description: VTK contains a NULL pointer dereference flaw in the DistinctCellTypesWorker() function in Common/DataModel/vtkUnstructuredGrid.cxx that is triggered when handling distinct cell types. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: VTK Common/DataModel/vtkUnstructuredGrid.cxx DistinctCellTypesWorker() Function Distinct Cell Type Handling NULL Pointer Derefer

Description: VTK contains a flaw in the vtkTemporalDataSetCache::RequestData() function in Filters/Hybrid/vtkTemporalDataSetCache.cxx that is triggered during the handling of a specially crafted non-time-varying dataset. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: VTK Filters/Hybrid/vtkTemporalDataSetCache.cxx vtkTemporalDataSetCache::RequestData() Function Non-time-varying Dataset Handling

Description: VTK contains a flaw in the vtkHigherOrderCurve::CellBoundary() function in Common/DataModel/vtkHigherOrderCurve.cxx that is triggered during the handling of plots along a bezier or lagrange curve. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: VTK Common/DataModel/vtkHigherOrderCurve.cxx vtkHigherOrderCurve::CellBoundary() Function Bezier / Lagrange Curve Plot Handling

Description: VTK contains a flaw in the vtkOpenGLPolyDataMapper::BuildBufferObjects() function in Rendering/OpenGL2/vtkOpenGLPolyDataMapper.cxx that is triggered when handling cell scalar. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: VTK Rendering/OpenGL2/vtkOpenGLPolyDataMapper.cxx vtkOpenGLPolyDataMapper::BuildBufferObjects() Function Cell Scalar Handling Do

Description: An issue was discovered in Legion of the Bouncy Castle BC Java 1.65 and 1.66. The OpenBSDBCrypt.checkPassword utility method compared incorrect data when checking the password, allowing incorrect passwords to indicate they were matching with previously hashed ones that were different.
Title: CVE-2020-28052

Description: xmltok_impl.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5 lacks certain validation of encoding, such as checks for whether a UTF-8 character is valid in a certain context.
Title: CVE-2022-25235

Description: In xsltCopyText in transform.c in libxslt 1.1.33, a pointer variable isn't reset under certain circumstances. If the relevant memory area happened to be freed and reused in a certain way, a bounds check could fail and memory outside a buffer could be written to, or uninitialized data could be disclosed.
Title: CVE-2019-18197

Description: Type confusion in xsltNumberFormatGetMultipleLevel prior to libxslt 1.1.33 could allow attackers to potentially exploit heap corruption via crafted XML data.
Title: CVE-2019-5815

Description: Integer overflow in SQLite via WebSQL in Google Chrome prior to 74.0.3729.131 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.
Title: CVE-2019-5827

Description: Possible cross-site scripting vulnerability in libxml after commit 960f0e2.
Title: CVE-2016-3709

Description: An issue was found in fts5UnicodeTokenize() in ext/fts5/fts5_tokenize.c in Sqlite. A unicode61 tokenizer configured to treat unicode "control-characters" (class Cc), was treating embedded nul characters as tokens. The issue was fixed in sqlite-3.34.0 and later.
Title: CVE-2021-20223

Description: TianoCore EDK II contains a logic flaw in the UpdateVariable() function in MdeModulePkg/Universal/Variable/RuntimeDxe/Variable.c that is triggered when handling time-based authentication variable. This may allow a local attacker to bypass configuration access controls and gain elevated privileges.
Title: CVE-2018-3613

Description: pip 1.3 through 1.5.6 allows local users to cause a denial of service (prevention of package installation) by creating a /tmp/pip-build-* file for another user.
Title: CVE-2014-8991

Description: The package snyk before 1.1064.0 are vulnerable to Code Injection when analyzing a project. An attacker who can convince a user to scan a malicious project can include commands in a build file such as build.gradle or gradle-wrapper.jar, which will be executed with the privileges of the application. This vulnerability may be triggered when running the the CLI tool directly, or when running a scan with one of the IDE plugins that invoke the Snyk CLI. Successful exploitation of this issue would likely require some level of social engineering - to coerce an untrusted project to be downloaded and analyzed via the Snyk CLI or opened in an IDE where a Snyk IDE plugin is installed and enabled. Additionally, if the IDE has a Trust feature then the target folder must be marked as ���trusted��� in order to be vulnerable. **NOTE:** This issue is independent of the one reported in [CVE-2022-40764](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3037342), and upgrading to a fixed version for this addresses that issue as well. The affected IDE plugins and versions are: - VS Code - Affected: <=1.8.0, Fixed: 1.9.0 - IntelliJ - Affected: <=2.4.47, Fixed: 2.4.48 - Visual Studio - Affected: <=1.1.30, Fixed: 1.1.31 - Eclipse - Affected: <=v20221115.132308, Fixed: All subsequent versions - Language Server - Affected: <=v20221109.114426, Fixed: All subsequent versions
Title: CVE-2022-24441

Description: pugixml contains a flaw in the parse_primary_expression() function in pugixml.cpp that is triggered as recursive function calls are not properly limited while parsing an argument list. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to exhaust available stack space and crash a process linked against the library.
Title: pugixml pugixml.cpp parse_primary_expression() Function Improper Recursion Handling Stack Exhaustion DoS

Description: pugixml contains a flaw in the parse_filter_expression(), parse_step(), parse_relative_location_path(), parse_expression_rec(), and parse_expression() functions in pugixml.cpp that is triggered as recursive function calls are not properly limited when handling Abstract Syntax Trees (AST) for parsed Xpath expressions. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to exhaust available stack space and crash a process linked against the library.
Title: pugixml pugixml.cpp Multiple Function XPath AST Handling Improper Recursion Stack Exhaustion DoS

Description: cereal contains a flaw that is triggered as std::shared_ptr values are cached using the raw pointer address as unique identifier. This results in unreliable deserialization when a new std::shared_ptr variable is allocated at the same address of a freed variable. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to have an unspecified impact.
Title: CVE-2020-11105

Description: cereal contains a flaw that is triggered as uninitialized memory is used when serializing C/C++ long double types. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to disclose potentially sensitive memory contents.
Title: CVE-2020-11104

Description: Twisted vulnerable to HTTP Request Smuggling Attacks before 20.3.0.
Title: WS-2022-0325

Description: ### Impact Twisted web servers that utilize the optional HTTP/2 support suffer from the following flow-control related vulnerabilities:  Ping flood: https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-9512 Reset flood: https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-9514 Settings flood: https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-9515  A Twisted web server supports HTTP/2 requests if you've installed the [`http2` optional dependency set](https://twistedmatrix.com/documents/19.2.0/installation/howto/optional.html).  ### Workarounds There are no workarounds.  ### References https://github.com/Netflix/security-bulletins/blob/master/advisories/third-party/2019-002.md  ### For more information If you have any questions or comments about this advisory: * Open an issue in [Twisted's Trac](https://twistedmatrix.com/trac/)
Title: GHSA-32gv-6cf3-wcmq

Description: HKDF in cryptography before 1.5.3 returns an empty byte-string if used with a length less than algorithm.digest_size.
Title: CVE-2016-9243

Description: Autobahn|Python before 20.12.3 allows redirect header injection.
Title: CVE-2020-35678

Description: In numbers.c in libxslt 1.1.33, a type holding grouping characters of an xsl:number instruction was too narrow and an invalid character/length combination could be passed to xsltNumberFormatDecimal, leading to a read of uninitialized stack data.
Title: CVE-2019-13118

Description: In numbers.c in libxslt 1.1.33, an xsl:number with certain format strings could lead to a uninitialized read in xsltNumberFormatInsertNumbers. This could allow an attacker to discern whether a byte on the stack contains the characters A, a, I, i, or 0, or any other character.
Title: CVE-2019-13117

Description: libxslt through 1.1.33 allows bypass of a protection mechanism because callers of xsltCheckRead and xsltCheckWrite permit access even upon receiving a -1 error code. xsltCheckRead can return -1 for a crafted URL that is not actually invalid and is subsequently loaded.
Title: CVE-2019-11068

Description: An exploitable use after free vulnerability exists in the window function functionality of Sqlite3 3.26.0. A specially crafted SQL command can cause a use after free vulnerability, potentially resulting in remote code execution. An attacker can send a malicious SQL command to trigger this vulnerability.
Title: CVE-2019-5018

Description: Inappropriate implementation in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 74.0.3729.108 allowed a remote attacker to bypass same origin policy via a crafted HTML page.
Title: CVE-2019-5822

Description: In SQLite 3.27.2, running fts5 prefix queries inside a transaction could trigger a heap-based buffer over-read in fts5HashEntrySort in sqlite3.c, which may lead to an information leak. This is related to ext/fts5/fts5_hash.c.
Title: CVE-2019-9936

Description: In SQLite 3.27.2, interleaving reads and writes in a single transaction with an fts5 virtual table will lead to a NULL Pointer Dereference in fts5ChunkIterate in sqlite3.c. This is related to ext/fts5/fts5_hash.c and ext/fts5/fts5_index.c.
Title: CVE-2019-9937

Description: Python contains a flaw in wsgiref.headers.Headers that is triggered as CRLF (Carriage Return and Line Feed) character sequences are not properly sanitized before being included in HTTP responses. This allows a remote attacker to inject additional headers into responses to conduct HTTP response splitting attacks.
Title: Python wsgiref.headers.Headers HTTP Response Splitting

Description: Python contains a flaw in the putline() function in Lib/ftplib.py that is triggered as certain input is not properly validated. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to inject CRLF sequences and potentially execute arbitrary FTP commands.
Title: Python Lib/ftplib.py putline() Function CRLF Injection Arbitrary FTP Command Execution

Description: Python contains an unspecified flaw in the getattr() function that may allow a context-dependent attacker to potentially execute arbitrary code. No further details have been provided.
Title: CVE-2019-10268

Description: Python contains a flaw in Lib/webbrowser.py hat is triggered as input passed in URLs is not properly validated before launching the URL handler. With a specially crafted URL, a context-dependent attacker can inject arbitrary command arguments.
Title: CVE-2017-17522

Description: Python contains a recursion flaw in the ast2obj_expr() function in Python-ast.c that is triggered when handling large expressions. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to exhaust available stack space and cause a crash.
Title: Python Python-ast.c ast2obj_expr() Function Recursion Handling Stack Exhaustion DoS Weakness

Description: Python / CPython contains a flaw in the Windows installer that is triggered as the search path is not properly controlled. This may allow a local attacker to trigger a repair operation and conduct a search path hijacking attack to gain elevated privileges.
Title: CVE-2022-26488

Description: Expat contains an overflow condition in the XML_GetBuffer() function in lib/xmlparse.c. The issue is triggered as user-supplied input is not properly validated when handling compressed XML content. This may allow an attacker to cause a buffer overflow and potentially execute arbitrary code.
Title: CVE-2015-2716

Description: Python contains a flaw in the URLopener.open() function in Lib/urllib.py that is triggered when handling URL using the 'local_file' and 'local-file' scheme. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to read arbitrary local files.
Title: CVE-2019-9948

Description: Python contains a flaw in the pysqlite_connection_create_collation() function in /Modules/_sqlite/connection.c that is triggered during the handling of specially crafted objects. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process built with the language.
Title: Python /Modules/_sqlite/connection.c pysqlite_connection_create_collation() Function Object Handling DoS

Description: Python contains a flaw in the tkinter.tix module that is triggered as input passed via the TIX_LIBRARY environment variable is not properly validated. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to set a specific installation directory and potentially execute arbitrary code.
Title: Python tkinter.tix Module TIX_LIBRARY Environment Variable Handling Arbitrary Command Execution

Description: Python contains an infinite loop condition in the email module that is triggered when parsing email header values. With a specially crafted email, a context-dependent attacker can hang a process using the module, potentially resulting in a denial of service.
Title: Python email Module Header Value Parsing Infinite Loop DoS Weakness

Description: Python contains multiple use-after-free flaws and an out-of-bounds indexing flaw in multiple functions in Objects/dictobject.c. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to use specially crafted input to cause a process utilizing the language to crash.
Title: Python Objects/dictobject.c Multiple Function DoS

Description: Python contains a flaw in the send_header() method in the BaseHTTPRequestHandler class in Lib/http/server.py that is triggered as CRLF (Carriage Return and Line Feed) character sequences are not properly sanitized before being included in HTTP responses. This allows a remote to inject additional headers into responses to conduct HTTP response splitting attacks.
Title: Python Lib/http/server.py BaseHTTPRequestHandler Class send_header() Method HTTP Response Splitting

Description: Python contains a flaw in gettext.c2py that is triggered during the handling of a specially crafted string. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to potentially execute arbitrary code.
Title: Python gettext.c2py String Handling Arbitrary Code Execution

Description: Python contains a use-after-free error in the decompress() function in /Modules/_lzmamodule.c. The issue is triggered when handling error paths. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to dereference already freed memory and potentially execute arbitrary code.
Title: Python /Modules/_lzmamodule.c decompress() Function Error Path Handling Use-after-free Arbitrary Code Execution

Description: Python contains a flaw that allows a cross-site redirection attack. This flaw exists because the urlsplit() function in Lib/urllib/parse.py does not properly handle URLs starting with double slashes. This could allow a context-dependent attacker to create a specially crafted link that, if followed, would redirect a victim from the intended legitimate web site to an arbitrary web site of the attacker's choosing.  Such attacks are useful as the crafted URL initially appears to be a web page of a trusted site. This could be leveraged to direct an unsuspecting user to a web page containing attacks that target client-side software such as a web browser or document rendering programs, as well as phishing attacks that mimic the legitimate site but send user-supplied information to the attacker.
Title: CVE-2021-3654

Description: Python contains an overflow condition in the binascii.b2a_qp() and binascii.a2b_qp() functions in /Modules/binascii.c. The issue is triggered as certain input is not properly validated. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to cause a buffer overflow, crashing a process utilizing the language or potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code.
Title: Python /Modules/binascii.c Multiple Functions Buffer Overflow

Description: Python contains a flaw in the _ConnectionBase.recv() function in Lib/multiprocessing/connection.py that is triggered when input is deserialized. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to execute arbitrary code.
Title: Python Lib/multiprocessing/connection.py _ConnectionBase.recv() Function Class Insecure Deserialization Arbitrary Code Execution

Description: Python for Windows contains a flaw that is triggered as the argument sequence is improperly handled when invoking subprocess.Popen() for a Windows batch file (BAT) using the CreateProcess() function. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to inject and execute arbitrary commands via the argument list.
Title: Python for Windows subprocess.Popen() Argument Sequence Handling Arbitrary Command Injection Weakness

Description: Python contains an integer overflow in Modules/_pickle.c that is triggered when serializing large amounts of pickle data. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to exhaust available memory and potentially cause a denial of service.
Title: CVE-2018-20406

Description: Python contains a flaw in Lib/zipfile.py that is triggered as it does not properly restrict the maximum size of extracted ZIP files. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to use a specially crafted ZIP file to consume excessive resources.
Title: CVE-2019-9674

Description: Python contains a flaw in plural.y that is triggered during the handling of a specially crafted MO file with plural-forms, which can cause an exhaustion of CPU resources. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to exhaust CPU resources in a process utilizing Python.
Title: Python plural.y Plural-Forms MO File Handling CPU Exhaustion DoS

Description: Python contains a flaw in the IPv4Interface and IPv6Interface classes in Lib/ipaddress.py that is triggered as the respective hash functions of the classes fails to properly hash objects that are subsequently put into a dictionary. This may allow a remote attacker to cause a hash collision, resulting in a denial of service for a program built with the language.
Title: CVE-2020-14422

Description: Python contains a flaw in urllib.parse.parse_qsl and urllib.parse.parse_qs in Lib/urllib/parse.py that is triggered during the handling of a specially crafted query that has parameters separated with semicolon characters (;). This may allow a remote attacker to poison the cache.
Title: CVE-2021-23336

Description: Python contains a flaw in the urlparse() function in Lib/urllib/parse.py that is triggered as backslashes in hostnames are not rejected when parsing URLs. With a specially crafted URL, a context-dependent attacker may cause URL authorities being handled incorrectly.
Title: Python Lib/urllib/parse.py urlparse() Function Hostname Backslash Character Incorrect URL Authority Handling Weakness

Description: Python contains a flaw in the _get_crl_dp() function in Modules/_ssl.c that is triggered when handling invalid distribution points in a X.509 certificate extension. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a Python process.
Title: CVE-2019-5010

Description: Expat XML Parser contains an overflow condition that is triggered as user-supplied input is not properly validated when handling malformed input documents. This may allow a remote attacker to cause a buffer overflow, resulting in a denial of service or potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code.
Title: CVE-2016-0718

Description: Python contains a flaw in the join() and canonicalize() functions in PC/getpathp.c that is triggered when loading the api-ms-win-core-path-l1-1-0.dll dynamic-link library (DLL). Description: Umbraco CMS contains a flaw related to request handling between a user and a server, where the server can be induced into performing unintended actions (Server Side Request Forgery aka SSRF). By sending a specially crafted request to the /backOffice/Api/Help/GetContextHelpForPage script, the server can be used to conduct host-based attacks. This may allow a remote attacker to bypass access restrictions (e.g. host or network ACLs), conduct port scanning of internal networks, enumerate internal hosts, or possibly invoke additional protocols (e.g. Gopher, TFTP) which may give additional control over such requests.
Title: Umbraco CMS /backOffice/Api/Help/GetContextHelpForPage Server-side Request Forgery (SSRF)

Description: Plone contains an unspecified flaw, which may allow an remote authenticated attacker to bypass restricted Python. No further details have been provided.

Description: Plone contains an unspecified flaw that may allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to information regarding registered users. No further details have been provided by the vendor.

Description: Plone contains a flaw that allows a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack. This flaw exists because the application does not properly sanitize input to the 'title' field before returning it to users. This may allow an authenticated, remote attacker to create a specially crafted request that executes arbitrary script code in a user's browser session within the trust relationship between their browser and the server.
Title: CVE-2020-7937

Description: Plone contains a flaw related to request handling between a user and a server, where the server can be induced into performing unintended actions (Server Side Request Forgery aka SSRF). By sending a specially crafted request with a file URL in the form for importing a calendar, the server can be used to conduct host-based attacks. This may allow an authenticated remote attacker to bypass access restrictions (e.g. host or network ACLs), conduct port scanning of internal networks, enumerate internal hosts, or possibly invoke additional protocols (e.g. Gopher, TFTP) which may give additional control over such requests.

Description: Plone contains a flaw in the str.format method that is triggered when accessing private content in through-the-web templates and scripts. This may allow an authenticated remote attacker to potentially partially escape the sandbox.

Description: Plone contains a flaw that allows a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack. This flaw exists because CMFDiffTool does not properly sanitize input when viewing a comparison of the differences between two versions before returning it to users. This may allow an authenticated remote attacker to create a specially crafted request that executes arbitrary script code in a user's browser session within the trust relationship between their browser and the server.
Title: CVE-2021-33513

Description: Plone contains a flaw that allows a cross-site redirection attack. This flaw exists because the application does not validate certain unspecified input before returning it to the user. This could allow a context-dependent attacker to create a specially crafted link that, if followed, would redirect a victim from the intended legitimate web site to an arbitrary web site of the attacker's choosing.  Such attacks are useful as the crafted URL initially appears to be a web page of a trusted site. This could be leveraged to direct an unsuspecting user to a web page containing attacks that target client-side software such as a web browser or document rendering programs, as well as phishing attacks that mimic the legitimate site but send user-supplied information to the attacker.
Title: CVE-2017-1000481

Description: Plone contains a flaw related to request handling between a user and a server, where the server can be induced into performing unintended actions (Server Side Request Forgery aka SSRF). Description: Plone contains an unspecified flaw related to the plone.app.contenttypes component that is triggered as write permissions are not properly enforced when handling PUT requests. This may allow a remote attacker to overwrite content.No further details have been provided.
Title: CVE-2020-7941

Description: Plone contains multiple unspecified flaws, which may allow an attacker to gain elevated privileges. No further details have been provided.
Title: CVE-2016-4041

Description: Plone contains a flaw that allows a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack. This flaw exists because the program does not properly sanitize input to uploaded SVG or HTML files before returning it to users. This may allow an authenticated remote attacker to create a specially crafted request that executes arbitrary script code in a user's browser session within the trust relationship between their browser and the server.
Title: CVE-2021-3313

Description: Plone contains multiple unspecified flaws which may allow an attacker to disclose sensitive information and potentially execute arbitrary code. No further details have been provided.
Title: Plone Multiple Unspecified Issues

Description: Plone contains a flaw that allows a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack. This flaw exists because the program does not validate input to the home_page member property before returning it to users. This may allow a remote attacker to create a specially crafted request that will execute arbitrary script code in a user's browser session within the trust relationship between their browser and the server.
Title: CVE-2017-1000482

Description: Plone contains a flaw that allows a cross-site redirection attack. This flaw exists because the application does not validate an unspecified URL before returning it to the user. This could allow a context-dependent attacker to create a specially crafted link that, if followed, would redirect a victim from the intended legitimate web site to an arbitrary web site of the attacker's choosing.  Such attacks are useful as the crafted URL initially appears to be a web page of a trusted site. This could be leveraged to direct an unsuspecting user to a web page containing attacks that target client-side software such as a web browser or document rendering programs, as well as phishing attacks that mimic the legitimate site but send user-supplied information to the attacker.
Title: CVE-2017-1000484

Description: Plone and Zope contain a flaw that allows a reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attack. This flaw exists because the program does not properly sanitize input before returning it to users. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to create a specially crafted request that executes arbitrary script code in a user's browser session within the trust relationship between their browser and the server.
Title: CVE-2021-33507

Description: Plone contains a flaw that allows a reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attack. This flaw exists because the login form does not validate input before returning it to users. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to create a specially crafted request that will execute arbitrary script code in a user's browser session within the trust relationship between their browser and the server.
Title: Plone Login Form Unspecified Reflected XSS

Description: Security Review (CST-E) This version has a known denial of service vulnerability, details can be found in the security advisories here: <https://doc.powerdns.com/authoritative/security-advisories/index.html>.
Title: CST-E has determined that this component is not generally safe to use.

Description: The WPA2 protocol contains a flaw during the PeerKey handshake that is triggered when establishing the STSL Transient Key (STK). With specially crafted, retransmitted handshake messages, a Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacker can reinstall an existing key, resetting the nonce and receive replay counter. This may in turn allow e.g. partially disclosing encrypted communication or injecting data into it.
Title: CVE-2017-13084

Description: The WPA2 protocol contains a flaw that is triggered as the integrity group temporal key (IGTK) is reinstalled when handling Wireless Network Management (WNM) Sleep Mode Response frames. With specially crafted messages, a Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacker can reinstall an existing key, resetting the nonce and receive replay counter. This may in turn allow e.g. partially disclosing encrypted communication or injecting data into it.
Title: CVE-2017-13088

Description: The WPA2 protocol contains a flaw during the four-way handshake that is triggered when establishing the integrity group key (IGTK). With specially crafted, retransmitted handshake messages, a Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacker can reinstall an existing key, resetting the nonce and receive replay counter. This may in turn allow e.g. partially disclosing encrypted communication or injecting data into it.
Title: CVE-2017-13079

Description: tinyDTLS contains a NULL pointer dereference flaw in the dtls_handle_message() function in dtls.c that is triggered during the handling of a Change cipher spec packet that lacks a pre-handshake. This may allow a remote attacker to crash a DTLS peer.

Description: The WPA2 protocol contains a flaw that is triggered as the group temporal key (GTK) is reinstalled when handling Wireless Network Management (WNM) Sleep Mode Response frames. With specially crafted messages, a Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacker can reinstall an existing key, resetting the nonce and receive replay counter. This may in turn allow e.g. partially disclosing encrypted communication or injecting data into it.

With specially crafted, retransmitted handshake messages, a Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacker can reinstall an existing key, resetting the nonce and receive replay counter. This may in turn allow e.g. partially disclosing encrypted communication or injecting data into it.

Description: The WPA2 protocol contains a flaw during the four-way handshake that is triggered when establishing the Pairwise Transient Key (PTK). Description: The WPA2 protocol contains a flaw during the group key handshake that is triggered when establishing the group key (GTK). This may in turn allow e.g. partially disclosing encrypted communication or injecting data into it.

Description: The WPA2 protocol contains a flaw during the group key handshake that is triggered when establishing the integrity group key (IGTK). This may in turn allow e.g. partially disclosing encrypted communication or injecting data into it.

This may in turn allow e.g. partially disclosing encrypted communication or injecting data into it.

This may allow an authenticated remote attacker to create a specially crafted request that executes arbitrary script code in a user's browser session within the trust relationship between their browser and the server.

This may allow a remote attacker to create a specially crafted request that executes arbitrary script code in a user's browser session within the trust relationship between their browser and the server.

Description: Mozilla Firefox contains an out-of-bounds write flaw in the vorbis_book_decodevs_add(), vorbis_book_decodev_add(), and vorbis_book_decodevv_add() functions in codebook.c that is triggered when decoding codebooks from Vorbis audio data. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code.

Description: Anti-Grain Geometry (AGG) contains an overflow condition in the render_scanlines_aa_solid() function in include/agg_renderer_scanline.h that is triggered as certain input is not properly validated when handling scanlines. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to cause a heap-based buffer overflow, resulting in a denial of service or potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code.

Description: SVG++ (svgpp) contains a NULL pointer dereference flaw in demo/render/filter.cpp that is triggered as feFlood filter support is not properly handled. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash the application.

Description: Anti-Grain Geometry (AGG) contains a recursion flaw in the rasterizer_cells_aa::line() function in include/agg_rasterizer_cells_aa.h that is triggered as certain input is not properly validated when handling recursion. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to exhaust available stack space and crash a process linked against the library.

Description: SVG++ (svgpp) contains a NULL pointer dereference flaw in the main() function in demo/render/svgpp_render.cpp that is triggered as image buffers are not properly handled for certain error conditions. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash the application.
Title: SVG++ (svgpp) demo/render/svgpp_render.cpp main() Function NULL Pointer Dereference DoS Weakness

Description: systemd contains a flaw that is triggered when mounting a filesystem with an overly long path. This may allow a local attacker to cause systemd, the services it manages, and the entire system to crash and stop responding.
Title: CVE-2021-33910

Description: Systemd contains a flaw in the rm_rf_children() function in shared/rm-rf.c that is triggered as the function will be recursively called when handling thousands of directories within the /tmp directory. This may allow a local attacker to exhaust available stack space and cause a crash.
Title: Systemd shared/rm-rf.c rm_rf_children() Function Recursive Directory Removal Stack Exhaustion Local DoS

Description: tcpdump contains a flaw in print-someip.c that is triggered as an array is not properly terminated when printing SOME/IP protocol packets. This may allow a remote attacker to cause an out-of-bounds read, resulting in a denial of service.

Description: tcpdump contains an out-of-bounds read flaw in the open_interface() function in tcpdump.c. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to disclose potentially sensitive information.

Description: Umbraco CMS contains a flaw as the application allows to persistently overwrite the ApplicationUrl if the ApplicationUrl is not configured in the application. This may allow an attacker to change URLs related to content notifications, healthcheck notifications, and Keep-Alive tasks.

Description: Microsoft ASP.NET Core Identity (Microsoft.AspNetCore.Identity) contains a flaw in Identity/SignInManager.cs that is triggered as the amount of incorrect login attempts are not properly restricted. This may allow a remote attacker to perform an unlimited number of login attempts and more easily bypass authentication mechanisms via a bruteforce attack.

Description: Microsoft KestrelHttpServer contains a flaw that is triggered when handling chunked requests with an unexpected end of the request content. With a specially crafted request, a remote attacker can cause a crash.

Description: Microsoft ASP.NET Core contains a flaw that allows a cross-site redirection attack. This flaw exists because the application does not validate certain unspecified input before returning it to the user. This could allow a context-dependent attacker to create a specially crafted link that, if followed, would redirect a victim from the intended legitimate web site to an arbitrary web site of the attacker's choosing.  Such attacks are useful as the crafted URL initially appears to be a web page of a trusted site. This could be leveraged to direct an unsuspecting user to a web page containing attacks that target client-side software such as a web browser or document rendering programs, as well as phishing attacks that mimic the legitimate site but send user-supplied information to the attacker.

Description: Microsoft ASP.NET Core contains an unspecified flaw that is triggered as web requests are not properly handled. This may allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service.

Description: Bitcoin Knots and Botcoin Core contain a flaw in the RPC service that is triggered as the program will consider a connection successful if it binds to either an IPv4 or IPv6 local host. This may allow an attacker with the ability to intercept network traffic (e.g. MitM, DNS cache poisoning) to bind the IPv4 localhost port and forward requests to an IPv6 localhost port. This can be used to intercept requests and disclose credential information.
Title: CVE-2018-20587

Description: Bitcoin Core contains a flaw in the Opt-in Full Replace-by-Fee Signaling functionality (BIP 125) that is triggered as replacement attempts of an unconfirmed child transaction is incorrectly rejected for transactions with certain 'nSequence' numbers. This may allow a remote attacker to conduct pinning attacks, resulting in a denial of service.
Title: CVE-2021-31876

Description: Red Hat Ceph contains a flaw in the Ceph RGW configuration that is triggered during the handling of a specially crafted HTTP header. This may allow a remote attacker to terminate the connection.

This may allow an attacker to cause a buffer overflow, resulting in a denial of service or potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code.
Title: Ceph crimson/osd/pg_backend.cc PGBackend::omap_get_vals_by_keys() Function Buffer Overflow

Description: Ceph contains an assertion failure flaw in the RGWSwiftWebsiteHandler::is_web_dir() function in rgw/rgw_rest_swift.cc that is triggered when handling empty subdirectory names in requests to the Ceph object storage (RGW) Swift API. With a specially crafted GET request, a remote attacker can cause RGW to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

Description: Red Hat Ceph contains a flaw in the handle_command() function in the ceph-mon and ceph-mgr daemons. This issue may allow a local attacker with 'mon r' capabilities to gain access to three whitelisted commands via the ceph-mon daemon. Additonally, messages are queued to the admin socket without properly checking if fsid is present via the ceph-mgr daemon. This may allow the attacker to make changes to the device configuration and conduct further attacks against the system.

Description: Ceph contains a flaw in the dashboard that is due to the application storing sensitive data in the in the browser’s localStorage. This may allow an attacker to gain access to the the JSON Web Token (JWT).

Description: GNOME GLib contains an out-of-bounds read flaw that is triggered as the g_memory_buffer_read_byte(), g_memory_buffer_read_int16(), g_memory_buffer_read_uint16(), g_memory_buffer_read_int32(), g_memory_buffer_read_uint32(), g_memory_buffer_read_int64(), and g_memory_buffer_read_uint64() functions in gio/gdbusmessage.c do not return a proper error message when parsing D-Bus messages. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
Title: GNOME GLib gio/gdbusmessage.c g_memory_buffer_read_*() Functions D-Bus Message Parsing Out-of-bounds Read DoS

Description: Icinga contains a flaw in the GelfWriter class in lib/perfdata/gelfwriter.cpp as X.509 server certificates are not properly validated. By spoofing the TLS/SSL server via a certificate that appears valid, an attacker with the ability to intercept network traffic (e.g. MitM, DNS cache poisoning) can disclose and optionally manipulate transmitted data.

Description: Icinga contains a flaw that is triggered as PKI ticket salt information is insecurely included within query results for ApiListener objects. This may allow an authenticated, remote attacker to disclose highly sensitive information that may be leveraged to gain elevated privileges.

Description: Icinga contains a flaw in the IdoMysqlConnection, IdoPgsqlConnection, IcingaDB, and ElasticsearchWriter API features that is triggered as sensitive information is exposed within associated object types. Description: mbed TLS and mbed Crypto contain a flaw that is triggered as constant times are not properly used during scalar multiplication. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to conduct a timing side-channel attack and disclose the private key that is currently in use.

Description: Mbed TLS contains a timing side-channel flaw related to RSA exponent blinding. The issue is triggered when performing modular exponentiation operations. This may allow a local attacker to recover private key information by observing a single operation.

Description: Mbed TLS and Mbed Crypto contain a flaw when using the Curve25519 and Curve448 Montgomery curves with Diffie-Hellman that is triggered as validity checks are insecurely skipped due to an incorrect assumption that the underlying multi-precision (bignum) arithmetic is constant-time. This may allow a local attacker to conduct a side-channel attack and disclose private key information.
Title: Mbed TLS / Mbed Crypto Montgomery Curves Diffie-Hellman Local Side-channel Attack Private Key Disclosure

Description: Mbed TLS and Mbed Crypto contain a flaw in the Scalar Multiplication function that is triggered during the import and validation of ECC keys which may allow a remote attacker to conduct a timing side channel attack.
